verses.verse: ה֖וֹי <WH1945> Ho Woe עִ֣יר <WH5892> 'ir city דָּמִ֑ים <WH1818> da-Mim; to the bloody כֻּלָּ֗הּ <WH3605> kul-Lah, completely כַּ֤חַשׁ <WH3585> Ka-chash of lies פֶּ֙רֶק֙ <WH6563> pe-rek [and] robbery מְלֵאָ֔ה <WH4395> me-le-'Ah, fruit לֹ֥א <WH3808> lo never יָמִ֖ישׁ <WH4185> ya-Mish departeth טָֽרֶף׃ <WH2964> Ta-ref. the prey

ק֣וֹל <WH6963> Kol The noise שׁ֔וֹט <WH7752> Shot, of a whip וְק֖וֹל <WH6963> ve-Kol and the noise רַ֣עַשׁ <WH7494> Ra-'ash of the rattling אוֹפָ֑ן <WH212> o-Fan; of the wheels וְס֣וּס <WH5483> ve-Sus horses דֹּהֵ֔ר <WH1725> do-Her, and of the pransing וּמֶרְכָּבָ֖ה <WH4818> u-mer-ka-Vah chariots מְרַקֵּדָֽה׃ <WH7540> me-rak-ke-Dah. and of the jumping

פָּרָ֣שׁ <WH6571> pa-Rash The horseman מַעֲלֶ֗ה <WH5927> ma-'a-Leh, lifteth up וְלַ֤הַב <WH3851> ve-La-hav both the bright חֶ֙רֶב֙ <WH2719> che-rev sword וּבְרַ֣ק <WH1300> u-ve-Rak and the glittering חֲנִ֔ית <WH2595> cha-Nit, spear וְרֹ֥ב <WH7230> ve-Ro and [there is] a multitude חָלָ֖ל <WH2491> cha-Lal of slain וְכֹ֣בֶד <WH3514> ve-Choed and a great פָּ֑גֶר <WH6297> Pa-ger; number of carcases וְאֵ֥ין <WH369> ve-'Ein none קֵ֙צֶה֙ <WH7097> ke-tzeh and [there is] none end לַגְּוִיָּ֔ה <WH1472> lag-ge-vi-Yah, of [their] corpses; יִכְשְׁלוּ yich-she-lu כוְכָשְׁל֖וּ <WH3782> ve-cha-she-Lu bereave קבִּגְוִיָּתָֽם׃ <WH1472> big-vi-ya-Tam. upon their corpses

מֵרֹב֙ <WH7230> me-Ro Because of the multitude זְנוּנֵ֣י <WH2181> ze-nu-Nei harlot זוֹנָ֔ה <WH2181> zo-Nah, of the harlot ט֥וֹבַת <WH2896> Toat one חֵ֖ן <WH2580> chen favour בַּעֲלַ֣ת <WH1172> ba-'a-Lat the mistress כְּשָׁפִ֑ים <WH3785> ke-sha-Fim; of witchcrafts הַמֹּכֶ֤רֶת <WH4376> ham-mo-Che-ret that selleth גּוֹיִם֙ <WH1471> go-Yim nations בִּזְנוּנֶ֔יהָ <WH2183> biz-nu-Nei-ha, of the whoredoms וּמִשְׁפָּח֖וֹת <WH4940> u-mish-pa-Chot and families בִּכְשָׁפֶֽיהָ׃ <WH3785> bich-sha-Fei-ha. through her witchcrafts

הִנְנִ֣י <WH2005> hin-Ni behold אֵלַ֗יִךְ <WH413> 'e-La-yich, I am against נְאֻם֙ <WH5002> ne-'Um Behold I [am] against thee saith יְהוָ֣ה <WH3068> Yah-weh the LORD צְבָא֔וֹת <WH6635> tze-va-'ot, of hosts וְגִלֵּיתִ֥י <WH1540> ve-gil-lei-Ti and I will discover שׁוּלַ֖יִךְ <WH7757> shu-La-yich thy skirts עַל־ <WH5921> 'al- over פָּנָ֑יִךְ <WH6440> pa-Na-yich; upon thy face וְהַרְאֵיתִ֤י <WH7200> ve-har-'ei-Ti and I will shew גוֹיִם֙ <WH1471> go-Yim the nations מַעְרֵ֔ךְ <WH4626> ma'-Rech, thy nakedness וּמַמְלָכ֖וֹת <WH4467> u-mam-la-Chot and the kingdoms קְלוֹנֵֽךְ׃ <WH7036> ke-lo-Nech. thy shame

וְהִשְׁלַכְתִּ֥י <WH7993> ve-hish-lach-Ti And I will cast עָלַ֛יִךְ <WH5921> 'a-La-yich and שִׁקֻּצִ֖ים <WH8251> shik-ku-Tzim abominable filth וְנִבַּלְתִּ֑יךְ <WH5034> ve-nib-bal-Tich; upon thee and make thee vile וְשַׂמְתִּ֖יךְ <WH7760> ve-sam-Tich and will set כְּרֹֽאִי׃ <WH7210> ke-Ro-'i. thee as a gazingstock

וְהָיָ֤ה <WH1961> ve-ha-Yah will come כָל־ <WH3605> chol all רֹאַ֙יִךְ֙ <WH7200> ro-'A-yich And it shall come to pass [that] all they that look יִדּ֣וֹד <WH5074> yid-Dod upon thee shall flee מִמֵּ֔ךְ <WH4480> mi-Mech, at וְאָמַר֙ <WH559> ve-'a-Mar from thee and say שָׁדְּדָ֣ה <WH7703> shad-de-Dah is laid waste נִֽינְוֵ֔ה <WH5210> nin-Veh, Nineveh מִ֖י <WH4310> mi Who יָנ֣וּד <WH5110> ya-Nud who will bemoan לָ֑הּ Lah; מֵאַ֛יִן <WH370> me-'A-yin her;whence אֲבַקֵּ֥שׁ <WH1245> 'a-vak-Kesh shall I seek מְנַחֲמִ֖ים <WH5162> me-na-cha-Mim comforters לָֽךְ׃ Lach.

הֲתֵֽיטְבִי֙ <WH3190> ha-tei-te-Vi Art thou better מִנֹּ֣א <WH4996> min-No No אָמ֔וֹן <WH528> a-Mon, multitude הַיֹּֽשְׁבָה֙ <WH3427> hai-yo-she-Vah that was situate בַּיְאֹרִ֔ים <WH2975> bay-'o-Rim, among the rivers מַ֖יִם <WH4325> Ma-yim [that had] the waters סָבִ֣יב <WH5439> sa-Viv round about לָ֑הּ Lah; אֲשֶׁר־ <WH834> 'a-Sher- her Whose חֵ֣יל <WH2426> cheil it whose rampart יָ֔ם <WH3220> Yam, [was] the sea מִיָּ֖ם <WH3220> mi-Yam the sea חוֹמָתָֽהּ׃ <WH2346> cho-ma-Tah. [and] her wall

כּ֥וּשׁ <WH3568> kush Ethiopia עָצְמָ֛ה <WH6109> 'a-tze-Mah [were] her strength וּמִצְרַ֖יִם <WH4714> u-mitz-Ra-yim and Egypt וְאֵ֣ין <WH369> ve-'Ein without קֵ֑צֶה <WH7097> Ke-tzeh; limits פּ֣וּט <WH6316> put Put וְלוּבִ֔ים <WH3864> ve-lu-Vim, and Lubim הָי֖וּ <WH1961> ha-Yu were among בְּעֶזְרָתֵֽךְ׃ <WH5833> be-'ez-ra-Tech. were thy helpers

גַּם־ <WH1571> gam- Yet הִ֗יא <WH1931> Hi, he לַגֹּלָה֙ <WH1473> lag-go-Lah Yet [was] she carried away הָלְכָ֣ה <WH1980> ha-le-Chah she went בַשֶּׁ֔בִי <WH7628> vash-She-vi, into captivity גַּ֧ם <WH1571> gam Also עֹלָלֶ֛יהָ <WH5768> 'o-la-Lei-ha her young children יְרֻטְּשׁ֖וּ <WH7376> ye-rut-te-Shu also were dashed in pieces בְּרֹ֣אשׁ <WH7218> be-Rosh at the top כָּל־ <WH3605> kol- of every חוּצ֑וֹת <WH2351> chu-Tzot; of all the streets וְעַל־ <WH5921> ve-'al- for נִכְבַּדֶּ֙יהָ֙ <WH3513> nich-bad-Dei-ha for her honourable men יַדּ֣וּ <WH3032> yad-Du and they cast גוֹרָ֔ל <WH1486> go-Ral, lots וְכָל־ <WH3605> ve-chol and all גְּדוֹלֶ֖יהָ <WH1419> ge-do-Lei-ha and all her great men רֻתְּק֥וּ <WH7576> rut-te-Ku were bound בַזִּקִּֽים׃ <WH2131> vaz-zik-Kim. in chains

גַּם־ <WH1571> gam- too אַ֣תְּ <WH859> 'at you תִּשְׁכְּרִ֔י <WH7937> tish-ke-Ri, Thou also shalt be drunken תְּהִ֖י <WH1961> te-Hi become נַֽעֲלָמָ֑ה <WH5956> na-'a-la-Mah; thou shalt be hid גַּם־ <WH1571> gam- too אַ֛תְּ <WH859> 'at you תְּבַקְשִׁ֥י <WH1245> te-vak-Shi thou also shalt seek מָע֖וֹז <WH4581> ma-'oz strength מֵאוֹיֵֽב׃ <WH341> me-'o-Yev. because of the enemy

כָּ֨ל־ <WH3605> Kal- All מִבְצָרַ֔יִךְ <WH4013> miv-tza-Ra-yich, All thy strong holds תְּאֵנִ֖ים <WH8384> te-'e-Nim [shall be like] fig trees עִם־ <WH5973> 'im- with בִּכּוּרִ֑ים <WH1061> bik-ku-Rim; with the firstripe figs אִם־ <WH518> 'im- lo יִנּ֕וֹעוּ <WH5128> yin-No-'u if they be shaken וְנָפְל֖וּ <WH5307> ve-na-fe-Lu they shall even fall עַל־ <WH5921> 'al- and פִּ֥י <WH6310> pi into the mouth אוֹכֵֽל׃ <WH398> o-Chel. of the eater

הִנֵּ֨ה <WH2009> hin-Neh Behold עַמֵּ֤ךְ <WH5971> 'am-Mech Behold thy people נָשִׁים֙ <WH802> na-Shim of thee [are] women בְּקִרְבֵּ֔ךְ <WH7130> be-kir-Bech, in the midst לְאֹ֣יְבַ֔יִךְ <WH341> le-'O-ye-Va-yich, unto thine enemies פָּת֥וֹחַ <WH6605> pa-To-ach shall be set wide נִפְתְּח֖וּ <WH6605> nif-te-Chu open שַׁעֲרֵ֣י <WH8179> sha-'a-Rei the gates אַרְצֵ֑ךְ <WH776> 'ar-Tzech; of thy land אָכְלָ֥ה <WH398> 'a-che-Lah shall devour אֵ֖שׁ <WH784> 'esh the fire בְּרִיחָֽיִך׃ <WH1280> be-ri-Cha-yich. thy bars

מֵ֤י <WH4325> mei thee waters מָצוֹר֙ <WH4692> ma-tzOr for the siege שַֽׁאֲבִי־ <WH7579> sha-'a-vi- Draw לָ֔ךְ Lach, חַזְּקִ֖י <WH2388> chaz-ze-Ki fortify מִבְצָרָ֑יִךְ <WH4013> miv-tza-Ra-yich; thy strong holds בֹּ֧אִי <WH935> Bo-'i go בַטִּ֛יט <WH2916> vat-Tit into clay וְרִמְסִ֥י <WH7429> ve-rim-Si and tread בַחֹ֖מֶר <WH2563> va-Cho-mer the morter הַחֲזִ֥יקִי <WH2388> ha-cha-Zi-ki make strong מַלְבֵּֽן׃ <WH4404> mal-Ben. the brickkiln

שָׁ֚ם <WH8033> m There תֹּאכְלֵ֣ךְ <WH398> to-che-Lech devour אֵ֔שׁ <WH784> 'Esh, There shall the fire תַּכְרִיתֵ֣ךְ <WH3772> tach-ri-Tech shall cut thee off חֶ֔רֶב <WH2719> Che-rev, thee the sword תֹּאכְלֵ֖ךְ <WH398> to-che-Lech it shall eat thee up כַּיָּ֑לֶק <WH3218> kai-Ya-lek; like the cankerworm הִתְכַּבֵּ֣ד <WH3513> hit-kab-Bed make thyself many כַּיֶּ֔לֶק <WH3218> kai-Ye-lek, as the cankerworm הִֽתְכַּבְּדִ֖י <WH3513> hit-kab-be-Di make thyself many כָּאַרְבֶּֽה׃ <WH697> ka-'ar-Beh. as the locusts

הִרְבֵּית֙ <WH7235> hir-Beit Thou hast multiplied רֹֽכְלַ֔יִךְ <WH7402> ro-che-La-yich, thy merchants מִכּוֹכְבֵ֖י <WH3556> mik-koch-Vei above the stars הַשָּׁמָ֑יִם <WH8064> hash-sha-Ma-yim; of heaven יֶ֥לֶק <WH3218> Ye-lek the cankerworm פָּשַׁ֖ט <WH6584> pa-Shat spoileth וַיָּעֹֽף׃ <WH5774> vai-ya-'Of. and flieth away

מִנְּזָרַ֙יִךְ֙ <WH4502> min-ne-za-Ra-yich Thy crowned כָּֽאַרְבֶּ֔ה <WH697> ka-'ar-Beh, [are] as the locusts וְטַפְסְרַ֖יִךְ <WH2951> ve-taf-se-Ra-yich and thy captains כְּג֣וֹב <WH1462> ke-Gov as the great grasshoppers גֹּבָ֑י <WH1462> goyAi; of grasshoppers הַֽחוֹנִ֤ים <WH2583> ha-cho-Nim which camp בַּגְּדֵרוֹת֙ <WH1448> bag-ge-de-rOt in the hedges בְּי֣וֹם <WH3117> be-Yom day קָרָ֔ה <WH7135> ka-Rah, in the cold שֶׁ֤מֶשׁ <WH8121> She-mesh [but] when the sun זָֽרְחָה֙ <WH2224> za-re-Chah ariseth וְנוֹדַ֔ד <WH5074> ve-no-Dad, they flee away וְלֹֽא־ <WH3808> ve-lo- not נוֹדַ֥ע <WH3045> no-Da' is not known מְקוֹמ֖וֹ <WH4725> me-ko-Mo and their place אַיָּֽם׃ <WH335> 'ai-Yam. where

נָמ֤וּ <WH5123> na-Mu slumber רֹעֶ֙יךָ֙ <WH7462> ro-'Ei-cha Thy shepherds מֶ֣לֶךְ <WH4428> Me-lech O king אַשּׁ֔וּר <WH804> 'ash-Shur, of Assyria יִשְׁכְּנ֖וּ <WH7931> yish-ke-Nu shall dwell אַדִּירֶ֑יךָ <WH117> 'ad-di-Rei-cha; thy nobles נָפֹ֧שׁוּ <WH6335> na-Fo-shu is scattered עַמְּךָ֛ <WH5971> 'am-me-Cha [in the dust] thy people עַל־ <WH5921> 'al- on הֶהָרִ֖ים <WH2022> he-ha-Rim upon the mountains וְאֵ֥ין <WH369> ve-'Ein and there מְקַבֵּֽץ׃ <WH6908> me-kab-Betz. and no man gathereth

אֵין־ <WH369> 'ein- There כֵּהָ֣ה <WH3545> ke-Hah [There is] no healing לְשִׁבְרֶ֔ךָ <WH7667> le-shiv-Re-cha, of thy bruise נַחְלָ֖ה <WH2470> nach-Lah is grievous מַכָּתֶ֑ךָ <WH4347> mak-ka-Te-cha; thy wound כֹּ֣ל׀ <WH3605> kol All שֹׁמְעֵ֣י <WH8085> sho-me-'Ei all that hear שִׁמְעֲךָ֗ <WH8088> shim-'a-Cha, the bruit תָּ֤קְעוּ <WH8628> Ta-ke-'u of thee shall clap כַף֙ <WH3709> chaf the hands עָלֶ֔יךָ <WH5921> 'a-Lei-cha, over כִּ֗י <WH3588> Ki, for עַל־ <WH5921> 'al- over מִ֛י <WH4310> mi whom לֹֽא־ <WH3808> lo- not עָבְרָ֥ה <WH5674> 'a-ve-Rah passed רָעָתְךָ֖ <WH7451> ra-'a-te-Cha over thee for upon whom hath not thy wickedness תָּמִֽיד׃ <WH8548> ta-Mid. alway
